timeline.message:
1792529: Virt-who is not able to upload the Hypervisor list if the manifest has content access mode as org_environment

This was a designed behavior originally. The requirements have now changed.

timeline.body:
Are we sure we want to completely remove the 'owner autobind disabled' functionality? I see that the change (43c11bac9095d0913414c77af5b7235947b87e36) that introduced the golden ticket restriction only added the second part of the if statement, while the `owner.isAutobindDisabled()` was still there.

I suppose the question is, is it a legitimate use case to have this restriction for when the owner has disabled autobind, even though they do not have content access mode as org_environment?

timeline.author: nikosmoum

replies.bodyText:
For the sake of creating the hypervisor/guest relationship, it makes no sense to block for autobind disabled.
This is left behind from when we handled guest migrations differently.
